The data in Splunk is now subject to auditing and compliance controls. A customer would like to ensure that at least one year of logs are retained for both
Windows and Firewall events. What data retention controls must be configured?

questions.question_text: What happens when an index cluster peer freezes a bucket?

choices.C: The cluster master will no longer perform fix-up activities for the bucket.
choices.D: All indexers with a copy of the bucket will immediately roll it to frozen.
choices.A: All indexers with a copy of the bucket will delete it.
choices.B: The cluster master will ensure another copy of the bucket is made on the other peers to meet the replication settings.

questions.question_text:
A customer has the following Splunk instances within their environment: An indexer cluster consisting of a cluster master/master node and five clustered indexers, two search heads (no search head clustering), a deployment server, and a license master. The deployment server and license master are running on their own single-purpose instances. The customer would like to start using the Monitoring Console (MC) to monitor the whole environment.
On the MC instance, which instances will need to be configured as distributed search peers by specifying them via the UI using the settings menu?

discussion.content: C, except indexers all other nodes must be configured as distsearch peers because after adding CM /MN all the indexers will be added to MC by default.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

Selected Answer: C
C includes all instances needed
C is the correct
Link https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.1.1/DMC/Addinstancesassearchpeers

choices.C: Search heads, deployment server, license master, cluster master/master node
choices.B: Indexers, search heads, deployment server, license master, cluster master/master node.

questions.question_text: What does Splunk do when it indexes events?

choices.B: Extracts metadata fields such as host, source, sourcetype.
choices.C: Performs parsing, merging, and typing processes on universal forwarders.
